title: Are Drinking Straws Dangerous? | Plastic Pollution Coalition
body: More than 500 million plastic straws are used every day in the U.S., typically enjoyed for minutes before being discarded. Too small to be recycled, plastic straws will persist in the environment well past our future generations lifetimes, breaking into tiny pieces over time. Plastic straws are the poster child for needless single-use plastic.
